east_asian.text: If you owe a dog anything, call him "sir."
A spark can start a fire that burns the entire prairie.
east_asian.description: A small problem can become a huge problem that can cause major damage.

east_asian.text: Complaining is the weak man’s weapon.
east_asian.description: Strong people solve problems instead of complaining about them.

east_asian.text: Dig the well before you are thirsty.
east_asian.description: Anticipate your needs before you need something.

east_asian.text: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day; teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
east_asian.description: Teaching people is better in the long run because it gives them the skills to provide for themselves as opposed to you doing things for them.

east_asian.text: He who answers is inferior to the one who asks the question.
east_asian.description: It’s better to be curious than knowledgeable.

east_asian.text: If you plant grass, you won’t get rice.
east_asian.description: Results match the work you put into them.

east_asian.text: It is better to travel ten thousand miles than to read ten thousand books.
east_asian.description: Lived experience is more valuable than enjoying it secondhand.

east_asian.text: The fat buffalo will attract the lean buffalo.
The old horse in the stable still yearns to run.
east_asian.description: Those who are older still have things they would like to accomplish.

east_asian.text: Do not talk Arabic in the house of a Moor.
If you wish your merit to be known, acknowledge that of other people.

A person who doesn't know but knows that he doesn't know is a student; teach him. A person who knows but who doesn't know what he knows is asleep; awaken him. But a person who knows and knows that he knows is wise; follow him.
A friend is one who warns you.
The greatest tranquility is when we desire nothing.
Tell me your friends, and I'll tell you who you are.
You cannot think you could teach a fish to swim.
Experience is a comb which nature gives to men when they are bald.
Building a castle is difficult. Defending and maintaining it is harder still.
Better to see something once than to hear about it a thousand times
The jay bird don’t rob his own nest.
